notes: Updated raceday morning. Confidence out of 10 for headline plays; main card uses 1–10 scale.

races.reason: Showed sharp trial speed and carries a light 54.5kg as a filly. Fastest trial time and an inside barrier indicate a strong early advantage.
Highest benchmark rating (62) in the field and recorded a strong final 600m in 35.0s last run. Carries 56.5kg which is solid at this class and should finish powerfully.
Top recent speed figure of 72 and blazed the fastest last 600m (33.8s) in her last run. Drawn the inside gate to save ground, despite 60kg she has the statistical edge in closing speed.
Best speed rating of 84 in this race and drops to a very low 52kg. Ran a strong 34.2s final 600m when charging home last start. Well drawn to settle handy and capitalize on the light weight.

Leads the field on recent ratings (74) and closed in 34.0s for the last 600m in a Group race, showing superior finishing speed. Carries a manageable 56kg at Listed level, making him statistically very competitive.

Boasts an elite speed rating of 114, far above the rest. Last start led throughout and still clocked a solid 35.0s final 600m. Even with top weight 59kg, his class and figures give him a clear statistical edge.

Highest handicap rating of 91 among these three-year-olds and drawn ideally in barrier 1. Ran a 34.5s last 600m in his recent run, indicating a strong finish. The combination of top rating and gate suggests a major advantage.

Recent performances point to an improving figure around mid-80s and he recorded one of the fastest final 600m splits (34.0s) in the lead-up race. Carries 56.5kg at set weights; despite a wide draw, his late-speed metric keeps him in contention.

Comes in with a respectable rating (~80) and a light weight of 57kg under set weights. Notably produced a very fast 33.8s last 600m when finally clear in her last start, suggesting she can outperform her odds if given a clear run.

One of the highest ratings in this field at 104 and an on-pace runner who can dictate. Carried 56kg to a strong placing last start; even with a moderate 35.2s last 600m while contesting the lead, his overall speed profile is superior here.

Specialist sprinter with a strong speed figure (86) in this company. Won here over 955m running a blistering final 600m around 33.0s. Well-weighted at 53kg in this handicap, indicating a clear statistical edge in early speed.

Lightly raced 3YO with a solid debut rating of 72. At set weights he carries 57kg which is standard for this Group 3. His jump-out times (approx 34.0s last 600m) and unbeaten record suggest he can match the top contenders on raw ability.

Brings a competitive speed rating of 75 among the 3YO fillies and is drawn perfectly in gate 1 to utilize her pace efficiently. Clocked a 34.5s final 600m last start, indicating she has the late speed to be a factor under equal weights (57kg).

Her rating of 70 is on par with the top fillies here and she showed a swift 34.2s final 600m in the Flight Stakes, highlighting her finishing strength. Although drawn wide (barrier 11), she carries 57kg like all rivals and her closing sectionals give her a statistical shot.

Boasts the highest speed rating (101) in this field and is the defending winner of this race. Barrier 2 and tactical speed are major pluses. Even though his last 600m (~36.0s) was moderate when outsprinted in the Coongy, his overall figures and proven 2040m strength make him the standout statistically.

Brings a strong rating of 84 for this mares’ Group race and impressed first-up, winning over 1800m with a closing 600m in ~34.5s. Carries the minimum 54kg under set weights, giving her a clear statistical advantage given her form and speed metrics.

In-form mare with a top-tier rating of 102 at the mile distance. She won her last start comfortably, showing a sharp turn of foot (around 34.0s for the final 600m). Drawn barrier 1, she should secure a ground-saving run and at 56kg (SWP conditions) her figures make her one of the statistically strongest contenders.

His rating of 91 is respectable in this Group 2 sprint field. Drawn the inside barrier, he can utilize his early pace to advantage. While his last 600m (35.5s) was only even, he is a genuine on-speed runner carrying 58.5kg at WFA, and his consistency makes him a value statistical chance to run a bold race.

Boasts the top speed rating of 92 among these 3YOs and likely would have won the G1 Caulfield Guineas with clear running. No issues with the 2040m trip and he unleashed an approximate 33.5s final 600m last start. With 57kg at set weights, his statistics (rating and sectionals) make him the one to beat.

The highest internationally rated horse in the field with a figure of 127, well above her Cox Plate rivals. She won the G1 Winx Stakes first-up and has been consistently near her top form. From barrier 5 she maps well and her steady 34.5s last 600m at 2000m last run confirms she remains on target. At 57kg (mare WFA), her class edge is clear on the numbers.

No official race rating yet, but her trial performance was quick. Gets a 2kg sex allowance, carrying just 54.5kg – the lowest in the field. Her trial sectional suggests she can match the race-experienced runners objectively.

Holds one of the top recent ratings in this Class 3 field (rating 63). Last start he set the tempo and still ran a respectable 36.0s final 600m. With a favorable draw (barrier 6) and carrying 56.5kg (near the class limit), his front-running stats give him an edge.

Undefeated so far, posting a strong rating of 65 which is the highest in this race. In his last win he ran the fastest closing split (~34.5s for 600m) showing an excellent finish. Drawn ideally in barrier 4, he carries 59kg but his superior figures make him the standout.

Top last-start rating of 84 in this Class 6 field. She was luckless last run yet still clocked a sharp 34.9s final 600m once in the clear. From barrier 2 she should secure a better run, and although she carries 59.5kg, her rating and sectional speed give her a clear statistical advantage.

His rating of 80 is the highest in this Benchmark 78 field. Importantly, he drops to just 52.5kg, well below many rivals. He often sets the pace and even with a modest ~35.5s last 600m, the massive weight advantage and solid overall figures point to a strong chance.

Brings a solid last-start rating of 67 after a convincing win. His final 600m in that victory (~35.5s) was among the quickest of the race. Nicely drawn in barrier 5 and carrying 58.5kg in a 2000m Benchmark 70, his form and times make him statistically one of the top contenders.

Has the highest official rating here (78) and is a noted fresh performer (two wins first-up). Trialled well leading into this, indicating a fast closing 600m around 34.0s when at peak. The negatives are a wide barrier (20) and top weight 60kg, but on pure numbers he has the ability to outrun his odds if things go right.

His rating of 76 is near the top of this Class 6 lineup. Drawn in barrier 2, he should get a favorable run throughout. Runs well fresh (as indicated by trial form) and a typical last 600m of ~35.0s in his races puts him right in the mix carrying a solid 56kg.

Comes off a strong form line with a rating of 66, which is competitive in this Benchmark 78. She ran a very fast last 600m of 34.4s when closing from well back last start. A big rise in class and a wide gate (20) temper confidence, but she carries the minimum 54kg, and her late speed figure suggests she can surprise if the pace is on.

Clearly the top-rated runner here with an 83 rating and comes in off a win. Gets in at a feather weight of 52.0kg after claims. Barrier 3 ensures a great position in running. His recent win featured a solid 35.6s last 600m and given the huge weight pull and strong form, he holds a significant objective edge.
